// Code generated by github.com/bckground/go-options. DO NOT EDIT.
// Source: configWithSuffix{}
//
// Generated by this command:
//
//	go-options -namespace=SuffixOptionNs -option=SuffixOption configWithSuffix
//

package test

import "fmt"

import "github.com/google/go-cmp/cmp"

type ApplySuffixOptionFunc func(c *configWithSuffix) error

func (f ApplySuffixOptionFunc) apply(c *configWithSuffix) error {
	return f(c)
}

func newConfigWithSuffix(options ...SuffixOption) (configWithSuffix, error) {
	var c configWithSuffix
	err := applyConfigWithSuffixOptions(&c, options...)
	return c, err
}

func applyConfigWithSuffixOptions(c *configWithSuffix, options ...SuffixOption) error {
	for _, o := range options {
		if err := o.apply(c); err != nil {
			return err
		}
	}
	return nil
}

type SuffixOption interface {
	apply(*configWithSuffix) error
}

type suffixOptionNamespace struct{}

var SuffixOptionNs suffixOptionNamespace

type suffixOptionMyFloatImpl struct {
	o float64
}

func (o suffixOptionMyFloatImpl) apply(c *configWithSuffix) error {
	c.myFloat = o.o
	return nil
}

func (o suffixOptionMyFloatImpl) Equal(v suffixOptionMyFloatImpl) bool {
	switch {
	case !cmp.Equal(o.o, v.o):
		return false
	}
	return true
}

func (o suffixOptionMyFloatImpl) String() string {
	name := "MyFloat"

	// hack to avoid go vet error about passing a function to Sprintf
	var value interface{} = o.o
	return fmt.Sprintf("%s: %+v", name, value)
}

func (suffixOptionNamespace) MyFloat(o float64) SuffixOption {
	return suffixOptionMyFloatImpl{
		o: o,
	}
}
